original_solution_mapping.L1: The third boy is 11 so the sum of the ages of the first two is 29-11 = <<29-11=18>>18
original_solution_mapping.L2: The ages of the first two boys are equal so each of them is 18/2 = <<18/2=9>>9 years

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7362.
    Returns: the age of the other two boys.
    """
    # L1
    total_sum_ages = 29 # The sum of the ages of three boys is 29
    third_boy_age = 11 # the third boy is 11 years old
    sum_of_first_two_ages = total_sum_ages - third_boy_age

    # L2
    num_boys_same_age = 2 # two of the boys are the same age
    age_of_each_boy = sum_of_first_two_ages / num_boys_same_age

    # FA
    answer = age_of_each_boy
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The third boy is {third_boy_age} so the sum of the ages of the first two is {total_sum_ages}-{third_boy_age} = <<{total_sum_ages}-{third_boy_age}={sum_of_first_two_ages}>>{sum_of_first_two_ages}
The ages of the first two boys are equal so each of them is {sum_of_first_two_ages}/{num_boys_same_age} = <<{sum_of_first_two_ages}/{num_boys_same_age}={age_of_each_boy}>>{age_of_each_boy} years

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The third boy is 11 so the sum of the ages of the first two is 29-11 = <<29-11=40>>40
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The ages of the first two boys are equal so each of them is 40/2 = <<40/2=20>>20 years

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
